# Collection of links {#sec-links}
This is where I collect all the links that I come across. You can see this as a work in progress. Some links will become part of the previous chapters, while other links will remain here. Please regard this as a roughly structured library of relevant resources. 

## Assessment given the existence of AI tools
Some links (in no particular order) that cover relevant strategies on how to assess student work, given the existence of AI tools.

- [UCL: Designing assessments in and AI enabled world](https://www.ucl.ac.uk/teaching-learning/generative-ai-hub/designing-assessments-ai-enabled-world)
- [UNF: ChatGPT-proof your course](https://unf.pressbooks.pub/chatgptinhighereducation/chapter/chatgpt-proof-your-course/)
- [UU: Can you still use take-home exams and essays?](https://www.uu.nl/en/education/educational-development-training/knowledge-dossier/the-influence-of-chatgpt-on-assessment-can-you-still-use-take-home-exams-and-essays)
- [Bower, M., Torrington, J., Lai, J.W.M. et al. (2024) How should we change teaching and assessment in response to increasingly powerful generative Artificial Intelligence? Outcomes of the ChatGPT teacher survey. Educ Inf Technol.](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10639-023-12405-0)
- [TILAPIA tool by Phil Newton & ChatGPT](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/a0knbe4l5vdmpr9l2xsox/AI-resilience-tool-v3.0.png?rlkey=ih87d4jh5lqu9l69ygr44s2se&dl=0)
